instruction: Is Twix eaten in the house B ?
input: The quiz was first published in 1962. We will change the original version slightly in the descriptions leaving the meaning as it is. There are five houses of different colors on the site: a red one, a green one, a blue one, a yellow one and a white one. There are five men of different nationalities living in them: an Englishman, a German, an Italian, a Spaniard, and a Chinese. These men grow the following berries in their gardens: raspberries, currants, gooseberries, strawberries, or grapes. Each of them has a pet: a dog, a cat, a parrot, a hamster, or fish. Each of them likes a certain brand of chocolate: Twix, Snickers, Mars, Bounty, Kitkat. Conditions of Einstein's riddle: 1. An Englishman lives in the red house. 2. A German owns a dog. 3. A man living in the green house plants raspberries. 4. An Italian plants grapes in his garden. 5. The green house is next to the white one to the right. 6. A man who likes Twix owns a cat. 7. A man living in the yellow house like Snickers. 8. There is a big variety of gooseberries in the central house. 9. A Spaniard lives in the house number one. 10. A parrot owner lives next to the Mars eater. 11. A man eating Snickers lives next to a man loving hamsters. 12. A man loving Kitkat and a man loving strawberries are the same person. 13.
